messages.subject: Back rub was Re: CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ours is definitely flu, scratchy stuff went away within a few days of the nasal drippage disappearing. I did have DH check my throat because I seemed to be
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Mindy Evans"
<mindyevans@...> wrote:
>
> Seems to be a nasty epidemic of strep throat going around. Doc said
> biggest they have seen in years, my daughter had all the same
> signs...Just FYI, if throat prob doesnt go away, you might look in
> there! <g>
>
Ours is definitely flu, scratchy stuff went away within a few days of
the nasal drippage disappearing. I did have DH check my throat because
I seemed to be sore longer than they did - no signs of anything amiss.
I think I just tend to take longer to recuperate (which is not
uncommon for folks with diabetes). I'm particularly careful about
strep because my mom is a cardiac patient and strep can be
particularly difficult/dangerous for her.

--Deb

messages.subject: Back rub was Re: CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: Seems to be a nasty epidemic of strep throat going around. Doc said biggest they have seen in years, my daughter had all the same signs...Just FYI, if throat
messages.messageBody:
Seems to be a nasty epidemic of strep throat going around. Doc said
biggest they have seen in years, my daughter had all the same
signs...Just FYI, if throat prob doesnt go away, you might look in
there! <g>

--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Debra Rossing"
<debra.rossing@...> wrote:
>
> Hugs to Trevor - we just got through a family go-round with the flu
> (fever, chills, cough, scratchy throat, nasal yuckies, tired, achy).
> Joshua much appreciated a nice warm bath when he was coming down with
it
> - it just felt good all over for him, eased the muscle achyness and
> relaxed his breathing some (and opened up his nasal passages too).
>
> Deb R
>

messages.subject: Back rub was Re: CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: Hugs to Trevor - we just got through a family go-round with the flu (fever, chills, cough, scratchy throat, nasal yuckies, tired, achy). Joshua much
messages.messageBody:
Hugs to Trevor - we just got through a family go-round with the flu
(fever, chills, cough, scratchy throat, nasal yuckies, tired, achy).
Joshua much appreciated a nice warm bath when he was coming down with it
- it just felt good all over for him, eased the muscle achyness and
relaxed his breathing some (and opened up his nasal passages too).

Deb R
